Michaels 2026 GIFTING & HOLIDAY TRENDS + INSIGHTS Summary : This is a styled photograph of a festive holiday coffee and dessert scene, featuring two cups of coffee, a decorated bundt cake, wrapped gifts, and gingerbread cookies, all arranged on a marble countertop with warm, soft lighting. photo: Scene Overview : • The main subjects are two porcelain espresso cups and saucers with gold rims and brown illustrations of buildings, each with a piece of candy on the saucer. • A bundt cake with white icing and small pine branches on top sits on a plate in the background. • A large, wrapped gift box with a red ribbon and a gingerbread house design, as well as a matching gingerbread house box, are present. • Additional elements include a red candy apple on a stick, gingerbread cookie pieces, and individually wrapped caramels. • The setting is a marble countertop against a white paneled wall, with soft, natural lighting and a warm, festive color palette (browns, reds, golds, and whites). Technical Details : • No scale bar or magnification; all items are life-sized. • The cups and saucers have a gold star pattern and gold handles. • The gingerbread house box has visible text: "ESPRESSO CUP & SAUCER". • The gift box is decorated with gold stars and a red ribbon. Spatial Relationships : • The two coffee cups are placed in the foreground, slightly to the right. • The bundt cake and gingerbread house box are in the background, left and center. • The wrapped gift box is to the right, behind the cups. • The candy apple and gingerbread cookie pieces are to the left, with the apple at the far left edge. Analysis : • The arrangement and props evoke a cozy, festive holiday atmosphere, emphasizing themes of gift-giving, celebration, and warmth. • The composition uses depth, with items layered from foreground to background, and a harmonious color palette to create visual unity. • The presence of matching motifs (gingerbread house designs on both the cups and boxes) reinforces a cohesive holiday theme. logo: Michaels 2026 GIFTING & HOLIDAY | TRENDS + INSIGHTS INTRODUCTION SEASON TO CELEBRATE HEARTFELT GIFTING & INTENTIONAL GATHERING Winter is a time to celebrate, reflect and reconnect. The holidays invite us to express our appreciation to our neighbors and co-workers, as well as our most cherished loved ones. Through thoughtful, handcrafted gifting and personalized, intentional celebrations, we renew traditions and strengthen connections with our families, friends, and the greater community. - **KEY HIGHLIGHTS:** - Nature inspired forms, natural materials and greenery are foundational holiday design elements. - Dark, rich tones and hues make their way into holiday palettes, infusing a sense of restorative calm and well-being. - Playful integration of bright whimsical colors, high shine finishes and vintage sensibilities. - Celestial themes and Deco-inspired motifs continue into the New Year. CONFIDENTIAL & PROPRIETARY INFORMATION. PLEASE DO NOT COPY. 2 Summary : This is a staged product photograph featuring a woven basket filled with chocolate bars, floral candles, and a floral-patterned envelope, set against a muted pink background. photo: Scene Overview : • Main subject is a light pink woven basket containing several chocolate bars, two floral-patterned candles, and a floral envelope. • The basket is placed centrally in the frame, with the contents arranged to display their labels. • The background is a solid muted pink, providing a warm and cohesive colour palette. • Lighting is soft and even, with minimal shadows, highlighting the pastel tones of the basket and products. Technical Details : • Chocolate bars are from the brand "King & Berry," with visible flavours including "Lavender Daze," "Pecan Date," "Bergamot," and "Mint Leaf." • The chocolate bar packaging features bold, colourful designs in purple, orange, teal, and yellow. • Two tall candles with floral patterns are positioned on the right side of the basket. • A floral-patterned envelope or card is tucked behind the chocolate bars. • No scale bar or magnification is present; all items are life-sized. Spatial Relationships : • Basket is in the foreground, occupying the lower half of the image. • Chocolate bars are arranged vertically, fanned out for visibility. • Candles are placed on the right, leaning outward. • The floral envelope is at the back, partially visible above the basket's rim. • The composition uses rule-of-thirds, with the basket and its contents forming the main focal point. Analysis : • The image conveys a sense of gifting or celebration, with coordinated pastel colours and floral motifs. • The arrangement highlights the variety of chocolate flavours and the decorative candles, suggesting a curated, artisanal selection. • The overall aesthetic is warm, inviting, and visually balanced, suitable for promotional or lifestyle use. Summary : This is a photograph of a dining room decorated for the winter holidays, featuring lush greenery and red berry garlands framing an entryway, a festive wreath on the wall, and a set dining table with candles. photo: Scene Overview : • The main subject is a dining room viewed through an interior doorway. • The doorway is elaborately decorated with a garland of green foliage and clusters of red berries, draping down the left side and across the top. • Inside the room, a round dining table is set for four, with plates, glasses, and a centerpiece of greenery and berries. • Three blue candles are lit on the table. • A circular wreath made of green foliage and orange berries hangs on the far wall. • The lighting is warm and soft, creating a cozy, inviting atmosphere. • The colour palette is dominated by greens, reds, browns, and warm wood tones. Technical Details : • No scale bar or magnification is present. • No visible text or UI elements. • The image is taken from a slightly oblique angle, showing both the decorated doorway and the dining area. Spatial Relationships : • The garland frames the left and top of the doorway, with a dramatic downward sweep on the left. • The dining table is centered in the room, with four wooden chairs around it. • The wreath is positioned on the wall directly opposite the doorway, above the table. • Windows on the left wall allow some natural light in, but the main illumination comes from overhead pendant lights and candles. Analysis : • The visual message emphasizes festive holiday decor, with an abundance of natural greenery and berries. • The arrangement draws the viewer’s eye from the entryway garland to the table and then to the wreath, creating a sense of depth and celebration. • The scene suggests a warm, welcoming environment prepared for a holiday meal. Summary : This is a photograph of a sculptural candle holder with five lit white candles, set against a muted green background and placed on a light stone surface. photo: Scene Overview : • Main subject is a beige, ceramic candle holder with a modern, curved design. • Five white candles are inserted vertically into the holder, all lit with visible flames. • The setting is minimalistic, with a smooth, light stone tabletop and a plain, dark green wall as background. • Lighting is soft and natural, casting gentle shadows and highlighting the texture of the ceramic. Technical Details : • No scale bar or magnification is present. • No visible text, UI elements, or annotations. • Candles are standard taper style, with some wax drips visible. Spatial Relationships : • Candle holder is placed in the foreground, occupying most of the lower half of the image. • Candles are arranged in a staggered line, with the curved portion of the holder extending to the right. • Flames are evenly spaced, creating a sense of rhythm and balance. Analysis : • The image emphasizes the artistic form and craftsmanship of the candle holder, with the lit candles adding warmth and ambiance. • The composition draws attention to the interplay between the organic curves of the holder and the vertical lines of the candles. • The overall mood is calm and elegant, suitable for interior design or product showcase. Summary : This image shows a set of six colorful party hats with marbled patterns and brown tassels, arranged on a white background. photo: Scene Overview : • Main subject: Six cone-shaped party hats. • Setting: White background, studio lighting. • Perspective: Slightly elevated, angled view showing the tops and sides of the hats. • Composition: Hats are arranged in a loose cluster, with some overlapping and some spaced apart. • Colour palette: Bright and varied—blue, green, yellow, orange, and pink marbled patterns; brown tassels. Technical Details : • No scale bar or magnification indicated. • No visible text or UI elements. • Each hat has a gold-brown tassel attached to the top and a thin elastic string for wearing. Spatial Relationships : • Foreground: Green and blue hats. • Background: Yellow, orange, and two blue/pink hats. • Hats are distributed across the frame, with some partially obscured by others. Analysis : • The image conveys a festive, playful atmosphere through the use of vibrant colors and whimsical marbled designs. • The brown tassels add a decorative touch and unify the set. • The arrangement suggests variety and celebration, suitable for a party or event. PLEASE DO NOT COPY. 3 2026 GIFTING IMPULSE & HOLIDAY | DRIVERS + MINDSET CREATE, CELEBRATE & DECORATE Key Drivers for the Creative Holiday Consumer For the average holiday consumer, gift giving fosters connection with family, friends, and community. For the creative holiday consumer, handmade and personalized gift giving is a mode of personal expression and unique interpersonal connection. “Personalising something…transforms the gift from a mere object into a meaningful experience…making the recipient feel more valued and cherished.” Marta Pizzetti, Diletta Acuti, Isabella Soscia & Michael Gibbert, from research for Psychology & Marketing
CreateCelebrateDecorate
Sustainable FutureValued ValuesSustainable Future
Hyper-IndividualizationOptimistic LivingHyper-Individualization
Optimistic LivingGlobal CitizenOptimistic Living
Economic Values
CREATIVE GIVINGCELEBRATION = CONNECTIONPERSONALIZED DECOR
1. Receiving a handmade or personalized gift gives the recipient a sense of "vicarious pride," they share a sense of accomplishment with the gift maker1. Celebrating holiday traditions reinforces bonds with family, friends and community on a regular basis1. DIY, upcycling, and creative reuse are sustainable, and often more economical solutions to buying exclusively new or single use holiday and celebration decor
2. Making or personalizing a gift offers a meaningful creative outlet of self expression to the giver2. Sharing holiday traditions with others from different cultures creates opportunities to start conversations, share new experiences, and create memories2. Holiday decoration allows for community connection and personal expression and curation
3. Handmade and personalized gifts are often kept much longer than other gifts, making them a more sustainable alternative to other gifts3. Hosting or attending holiday celebrations is a tangible expression of optimistic, forward-looking thinking3. Holiday decoration is an important demonstration of personal taste and community optimism
Handmade and personalized gifting carry added value for the recipient and gifter. Position Michaels as the premier destination for handmade gifting and personalization supplies.Holiday celebrations and traditions play an essential role in maintaining personal connections to family members, friends, and the larger community. Position Michaels as the go-to, local destination for holiday and traditional celebration needs.Help customers decorate for the holidays with their personal values in mind. Promote Michaels as the sustainable, budget friendly resource for unique, finished and DIY holiday decor.

PLEASE DO NOT COPY. 4 IN THE News: MARKET INSIGHTS FULLY BAKED 48% of people who celebrate Christmas, 49% of people who celebrate Hanukkah, and and 33% of people who celebrate New Years Eve plan to cook or bake holiday items at home. SOURCE: Lending Tree 83% 83% of holiday shoppers plan to buy themselves a gift during the holiday season. SOURCE: Retail Dive Summary : This infographic presents a statistic about Christmas celebration rates in the United States, citing Gallup as the source. statistic infographic: Headline Figure : • Large text displays “90%”. • The percentage refers to the proportion of Americans who celebrate Christmas in some form. Supporting Text : • States: “Roughly 90% of Americans celebrate Christmas in some form, making it the most widely observed winter holiday.” • Source attribution: “SOURCE: Gallup”. Design Encodings : • Minimalist design with large, bold percentage. • Supporting text in smaller, lighter font below the headline figure. Analysis : • The infographic visually emphasises the high prevalence of Christmas celebration in the US, positioning it as the dominant winter holiday based on Gallup data. Summary : This graphic presents statistics on impulse holiday purchases among Americans, specifying the recipients of such purchases and their respective percentages. textual infographic: Headline & Source : • Headline: "IN THE MOMENT" • Source: Bankrate Statistics Presented : • 31% of Americans made an impulse holiday purchase for their family members. • 15% made one for friends. • 5% made one for acquaintances. • 28% made one for themselves. Design & Layout : • Centered white text on a dark gray background. • Headline in uppercase, followed by a horizontal divider. • Percentages and recipient categories listed in a single paragraph. Analysis : • Family members are the most common recipients of impulse holiday purchases, followed by purchases for oneself. • Purchases for friends and acquaintances are less frequent. • The data highlights the tendency for Americans to make impulse purchases both for others and themselves, with family being the primary focus. SPENDING HABITS People spend an average of $902 per person across gifts, food, decorations, and other holiday items. SOURCE: Time ## PARTY RESOLUTIONS 60% of Americans plan to celebrate New Year's Eve with family or friends, and 24% will attend public events or parties. SOURCE: WalletHub MAKE IT PERSONAL 65% of consumers purchased personalized gifts, and 80% believe personalized gifts are more thoughtful than non-personalized gifts. SOURCE: Gift A Feeling ## DECOR GALORE 98% of Americans who celebrate Christmas decorate the inside of their homes, and about 88% also adorn the exterior of their homes. SOURCE: Angi.com Summary : This figure presents a statistic about the perceived impact of gift giving on personal relationships, sourced from LinkedIn. statistic figure: Relationship Builder Statistic : • 85% of people think gift giving strengthens personal relationships. • The statistic is labeled "RELATIONSHIP BUILDER." • Source is cited as LinkedIn. Design Encodings : • Large, bold "85%" displayed on the left. • Supporting text on the right in smaller font. • Minimalist, monochrome design. Analysis : • The figure highlights a strong majority belief (85%) that gift giving is beneficial for building and strengthening personal relationships, according to LinkedIn data. The scene also includes a roll of matching ribbon and a sheet of the same wrapping paper. A quote about the meaning of exchanging presents is visible in the upper left. photo: Scene Overview : • Main subject is a rectangular gift box wrapped in marbled paper (red, green, white) and tied with a dark green satin ribbon in a bow. • The box is placed on a white speckled surface, with a roll of the same green ribbon and a sheet of matching wrapping paper nearby. • The composition is top-down, with the box in the lower left, ribbon roll in the upper right, and wrapping paper extending diagonally. • Lighting is bright and even, with soft shadows cast by the box and ribbon. • Colour palette is festive: red, green, white, and dark green. Analysis : • The image visually communicates the care and thoughtfulness involved in gift wrapping, reinforcing the quote about the relational meaning of exchanging presents. • The harmonious colour scheme and neat arrangement evoke a sense of celebration and attention to detail. PLEASE DO NOT COPY. 6 SECTION OVERVIEW | GIFTING Gifting inspiration for everyone on the list, from makers to bakers to next door neighbors PRODUCT DIRECTION 03 ALL IN THE FAMILY Gifts for Family and Furry Friends Summary : This image is a festive collage featuring black-and-white family photographs embedded within illustrated Christmas ornament designs on a marbled background. photo: Scene Overview : • The main subjects are several black-and-white family photographs, each framed within illustrated Christmas ornament shapes. • The ornaments are stylized with colorful borders (pink, blue, green, red) and decorative patterns (leaves, stars, dots). • The background is a marbled swirl of pale blue, cream, and yellow tones, enhancing the festive and artistic feel. • The composition is vertical, with ornaments and photos distributed across the image, some overlapping. Technical Details : • No scale bar, magnification, or scientific modality is present. • No visible on-image text or UI elements. • The photographs are monochrome, while the ornament illustrations are brightly colored. Spatial Relationships : • Ornaments are arranged in a scattered, overlapping pattern, with some partially cropped by the image edges. • The largest ornament is centrally placed, containing a group family photo. • Smaller ornaments with individual or paired portraits are positioned around the central ornament, creating a balanced layout. Analysis : • The image conveys a festive, family-oriented message, blending personal photographs with holiday-themed illustrations. • The use of marbled background and colorful ornament frames creates a cheerful, celebratory atmosphere. • The arrangement draws attention to the central family photo, suggesting it is the focal point of the collage. PRODUCT DIRECTION 01 HANDMADE GIFTING Thoughtful, Handmade Gifts for Every Skill Level Summary : This image shows two embroidered keychain tags, one labeled "Lisa" and the other labeled "work," attached to a metal keyring. photo: Scene Overview : • The main subjects are two fabric keychain tags. • The upper tag is dark blue with pink trim and features the cursive word "Lisa" embroidered in white thread. • The lower tag is beige with blue trim and features the cursive word "work" embroidered in red thread. • Both tags are attached to a single metal keyring at the left edge. • The background is a plain, light cream color. Technical Details : • No scale bar or magnification is present. • Embroidery is done in cursive script. • The tags have a wavy rectangular shape with stitched borders. • The keyring is circular and metallic. Spatial Relationships : • The "Lisa" tag is positioned above and slightly overlaps the "work" tag. • Both tags are oriented horizontally, with the keyring on the left side. • The tags are arranged so that their text is clearly visible. Analysis : • The image visually distinguishes two keychain tags, likely for organizational or identification purposes, with personalized and functional labels ("Lisa" and "work"). • The use of different colors and words suggests a system for categorizing keys or items. PRODUCT DIRECTION 04 IT TAKES A VILLAGE Gifts for Those Who Make the World Go Round Summary : This image shows a collection of yarn balls and pom-poms arranged on a dark purple surface, alongside two circular objects with bow-shaped decorations. photo: Scene Overview : • The main subjects are several yarn balls and pom-poms in pastel and earthy tones (light blue, tan, gray, pink, and olive green). • Two circular objects, possibly pom-pom makers, are present at the bottom right, each decorated with a bow-shaped piece (one pink, one yellow with a magenta triangle). • The composition is top-down, with the yarn and pom-poms clustered in the upper left and the circular objects in the lower right. • Lighting is even, with no harsh shadows, and the colour palette is soft and warm. Technical Details : • No scale bar or magnification is present. • No visible text or UI elements. Spatial Relationships : • Yarn balls and pom-poms are grouped together in the upper left quadrant. • The two circular objects are placed side by side in the lower right quadrant. • The arrangement creates a diagonal visual flow from top left to bottom right. Analysis : • The image visually contrasts the soft, textured pom-poms and yarn with the smooth, geometric shapes of the circular objects and bows. • The colour coordination and placement suggest a crafting or DIY theme, possibly related to making pom-poms or decorative bows. PRODUCT DIRECTION 02 PERSONALIZED GIFTING One-of-a-kind personalized Gifts Using Crafting Technology Summary : This photograph shows a sewing workspace setup, featuring a white sewing machine, a basket of thread spools, folded fabrics, scissors, and a small potted plant arranged on a light wooden table. photo: Scene Overview : • Main subject is a white sewing machine positioned prominently in the right foreground. • The setting is a clean, well-lit workspace with a neutral background. • Composition includes a basket of multicoloured thread spools to the left of the machine, several neatly folded pastel fabrics, a pair of black-handled scissors, and a small potted plant in a terracotta pot. • Lighting is soft and even, with no harsh shadows; the colour palette is light and pastel, contributing to a calm and organized atmosphere. Technical Details : • No scale bar or magnification is present. • No visible text or UI elements on the machine or other objects. • The sewing machine is unplugged and not in use at the moment the photo was taken. Spatial Relationships : • The sewing machine occupies the right side of the image, with the basket of threads and plant on the left, and fabrics and scissors in the foreground. • Objects are arranged to suggest readiness for a sewing project, with tools and materials within easy reach. Analysis : • The image conveys a sense of preparation and organization for sewing or crafting activities, highlighting essential tools and materials in a visually appealing arrangement. • The inclusion of the plant adds a touch of warmth and life to the workspace, while the pastel colours and tidy layout suggest a calm, creative environment. PRODUCT DIRECTION 05 READY-TO-GO GIFTS Expertly Curated Finished Gifts for Every Interest Summary : This is a photograph of a curated travel-themed gift box containing various travel essentials and self-care items, arranged neatly in a shallow box with shredded paper filling. photo: Scene Overview : • The main subject is a rectangular gift box filled with travel-related items. • The box contains: a blue sleep mask, a small spray bottle, a spoon, a dropper bottle, a tube of cream, a box with an airplane graphic, a map-themed item, and other small packaged items. • The items are arranged on a bed of light brown shredded paper. • The color palette is soft and neutral, with light blues, creams, and browns dominating the scene. • The lighting is natural and soft, casting gentle shadows and highlighting the textures of the items and packaging. Spatial Relationships : • The sleep mask is placed in the upper right section of the box. • The airplane graphic box is in the upper left. • The dropper bottle and tube are in the lower right. • The spoon and spray bottle are centrally located. • The items are evenly spaced, with shredded paper filling gaps for a tidy presentation. Analysis : • The arrangement and selection of items suggest this is a thoughtfully assembled travel gift set, likely intended for comfort and convenience during travel. The cohesive color scheme and neat organization enhance the sense of luxury and care. Michaels 2026 GIFTING & HOLIDAY | TRENDS + INSIGHTS CONFIDENTIAL & PROPRIETARY INFORMATION. Scottish Breakfast Tea," and a ceramic mug with red and cream vertical stripes. • The perspective is a top-down view, showing all items clearly within the box. • The composition is organized, with the blanket and socks occupying the left half, and the book, tea container, and mug on the right, all nestled in straw-like packing material. • Lighting is soft and natural, with warm tones complementing the earthy colors of the blanket and box. Spatial Relationships : • The blanket and socks are placed on the left, with the socks laid on top of the blanket. • The book is positioned in the upper right corner, partially overlapping the blanket. • The tea container and mug are in the lower right, with the mug tilted and resting against the container. • The straw packing material fills gaps and provides a uniform background for the items. Analysis : • The arrangement and selection of items suggest a theme of comfort and travel, likely intended as a thoughtful gift for someone interested in Scottish culture or outdoor adventures. • The personalized embroidery on the blanket adds a bespoke touch, while the inclusion of tea and a travel guidebook enhances the sense of relaxation and exploration. • The color palette is cohesive, with earthy and muted tones creating a warm, inviting atmosphere. PRIMARY COLLECTION 01 SPIRIT OF GIVING OVERVIEW A truly thoughtful, intentional gift lets the recipient know they are valued, appreciated, and seen. For the giver, giving can forge bonds, express gratefulness, and be a conduit for creativity and personal expression. Through handmade, personalized, family, community gifting, and well-chosen ready-to-go gifting, givers and recipients can discover shared values, interests, hobbies, and learn a little bit more about what makes the other so unique. CONSUMER Virtually every consumer has gifting needs during the holidays. Explorers, Creators, and Artists will be first to try handmade gift ideas. Curators will enjoy perfecting personalized gifts. Variety Seekers will enjoy easy to complete craft and baking kits, and will be first in the impulse line. OPPORTUNITY Christmas is the perfect time for experienced crafters to express their talents, and aspiring crafters to try their hand at gift making. Personalized gifting needs provide a reason to invest in craft technology. Family gifting needs provide an opportunity for multiple craft kits and large crafting supply purchases, while community gifting is the perfect opportunity for themed gift baskets and repeat item purchases. Summary : This image shows a collection of five handkerchiefs, each embroidered with a different name or initials, arranged in a fan-like overlapping pattern on a neutral background. photo: Scene Overview : • Main subjects are five handkerchiefs, each featuring embroidered names or initials: "Olivia", "Annie", "M.T.R.", "Kate", and one with no visible name (striped pattern). • The handkerchiefs are arranged in a visually appealing, overlapping layout, with each corner pointing outward. • Lighting is natural and soft, casting gentle shadows and highlighting the texture of the fabric. • Colour palette includes white, cream, pink, and striped blue, with embroidery in yellow, blue, purple, and navy. Technical Details : • Embroidery is done in cursive script, with each name or initial in a different thread colour. • Edges of the handkerchiefs are finished with contrasting piping or decorative trim (orange, black, red, multicolour). • No scale bar or magnification; image is at standard photographic scale. (purple embroidery) and "Kate" (navy embroidery). • "M.T.R." is at the bottom left, with a pink background. • "Kate" is at the bottom right, with a white background and multicolour edge trim. • The striped handkerchief (top right) has no visible embroidery in the crop. Analysis : • The arrangement highlights the individuality of each handkerchief through unique embroidery and edge finishes. • The image conveys a sense of personalization and craftsmanship, with each item distinct yet part of a cohesive set. • The overlapping layout draws attention to the names and initials, suggesting a theme of customisation or gifting. Summary : This image shows five embroidered Christmas-themed tags, each with a scalloped edge and green border, featuring different festive motifs and personalized names. photo: Scene Overview : • The main subjects are five white, scalloped-edge tags with green borders, arranged overlapping on a light background. • Each tag is embroidered with a different Christmas motif and a name in green cursive script. • Motifs include: a nutcracker (Graham), a dog with a red ribbon (Larkin), a Christmas tree (Mom), a ballerina (Heidi), and Santa Claus (Dad). • The tags are festive and decorative, likely intended for gift labeling or holiday decoration. Technical Details : • No scale bar or magnification is present. • Embroidery is done in coloured thread, with green used for borders and names, and other colours for the motifs. • Each tag has a circular hole at the top for attachment, reinforced with green stitching. Spatial Relationships : • Tags are arranged in a loose cluster, overlapping each other. • The tag with the ballerina (Heidi) is centrally placed, with the other four tags radiating around it. • The motifs and names are centered on each tag, with the motif above the name. Analysis : • The image conveys a personalized, festive holiday theme, with each tag representing a different family member and Christmas motif. • The use of embroidery and scalloped edges suggests a handmade, traditional aesthetic. • The arrangement and motifs highlight family and holiday spirit. Summary : This is a photo of a yellow gift box containing rectangular cookies, each stamped with a holiday or personalized message. Michaels 2026 GIFTING & HOLIDAY | TRENDS + INSIGHTS WRAP UP # GIFTING, UNWRAPPED THE THOUGHT DOES COUNT KEY TAKEAWAYS 01 CREATE Handmade and personalized gifts are seen as more thoughtful and valuable than other gifts, both to the gifter and to the recipient. ACTION PLAN: Promote Michaels as the one-stop shop for DIY and personalized gifting. Create a maker wishlist registry so non-experts can easily shop for the experts in a more personal way than a gift card. Assort themed collections for Christmas Eve boxes, kindness jars, and customized gift baskets and group gifts. 02 CELEBRATE Holiday gifting is a genuine expression of appreciation and care from the giver to the recipient, and can form and enrich social bonds. ACTION PLAN: Position crafting as a gift of shared experiences. Assort entry level to expert level craft kits. Provide group and family crafting inspiration along with itemized shopping lists and/or one click “add all to cart” for group crafting supply lists. 03 DECORATE For aspiring and entry level creative customers who want to make a handmade gift, but aren’t sure where to start, handmade decor items are a great place to start. ACTION PLAN: Incorporate handmade holiday decor inspiration, kits, and supplies into holiday gifting promotions. Assort items based on the recipient (teacher, grandparent etc.) and by the maker’s skill level. CONFIDENTIAL & PROPRIETARY INFORMATION. For aspiring crafters and artists, the New Year is the perfect time to learn a new craft or start a new creative practice. ACTION PLAN: Promote the holidays as a time for expert artists and crafters to stock up on creative supplies. Take advantage of the holiday season as an entryway for aspiring creative consumers to take up a crafting habit that can continue into the New Year. 02 CELEBRATE Holiday parties happen everywhere, from workplaces and schoolrooms to first apartments and family homes. ACTION PLAN: Be the go-to supplier for on-trend finished and DIY party goods, for holiday parties of any size and personal style. Offer distinct holiday trend stories, with plenty of mix and match pieces for perfect party personalization. 03 DECORATE Most people who celebrate the holidays will also decorate their homes. ACTION PLAN: Make holiday decorating inspiring and easy with shoppable “rooms” at key locations where shoppers can purchase finished decor bundles such as tabletop themed party solutions for eight, complete Christmas tree decor sets, or all-in-one mantel decorating solutions. Summary : This is a styled photograph of a festive holiday coffee and dessert scene, featuring two cups of coffee, a decorated bundt cake, wrapped gifts, and gingerbread cookies, all arranged on a marble countertop with warm, soft lighting.

photo:
Scene Overview :
  • The main subjects are two porcelain espresso cups and saucers with gold rims and brown illustrations of buildings, each with a piece of candy on the saucer.
  • A bundt cake with white icing and small pine branches on top sits on a plate in the background.
  • A large, wrapped gift box with a red ribbon and a gingerbread house design, as well as a matching gingerbread house box, are present.
  • Additional elements include a red candy apple on a stick, gingerbread cookie pieces, and individually wrapped caramels.
  • The setting is a marble countertop against a white paneled wall, with soft, natural lighting and a warm, festive color palette (browns, reds, golds, and whites).

Technical Details :
  • No scale bar or magnification; all items are life-sized.
  • The cups and saucers have a gold star pattern and gold handles.
  • The gingerbread house box has visible text: "ESPRESSO CUP & SAUCER".
  • The gift box is decorated with gold stars and a red ribbon.

Spatial Relationships :
  • The two coffee cups are placed in the foreground, slightly to the right.
  • The bundt cake and gingerbread house box are in the background, left and center.
  • The wrapped gift box is to the right, behind the cups.
  • The candy apple and gingerbread cookie pieces are to the left, with the apple at the far left edge.

Analysis :
  • The arrangement and props evoke a cozy, festive holiday atmosphere, emphasizing themes of gift-giving, celebration, and warmth.
  • The composition uses depth, with items layered from foreground to background, and a harmonious color palette to create visual unity.
  • The presence of matching motifs (gingerbread house designs on both the cups and boxes) reinforces a cohesive holiday theme.

2026 GIFTING & HOLIDAY  |  TRENDS + INSIGHTS
INTRODUCTION

SEASON TO CELEBRATE
HEARTFELT GIFTING & INTENTIONAL GATHERING

Winter is a time to celebrate, reflect and reconnect. The holidays invite us to express our appreciation to our neighbors and co-workers, as well as our most cherished loved ones. Through thoughtful, handcrafted gifting and personalized, intentional celebrations, we renew traditions and strengthen connections with our families, friends, and the greater community.

- **KEY HIGHLIGHTS:**

Key Drivers for the Creative Holiday Consumer
For the average holiday consumer, gift giving fosters connection with family, friends, and community. For the creative holiday consumer, handmade and personalized gift giving is a mode of personal expression and unique interpersonal connection.
“Personalising something…transforms the gift from a mere object into a meaningful experience…making the recipient feel more valued and cherished.”

Marta Pizzetti, Diletta Acuti, Isabella Soscia & Michael Gibbert,
from research for Psychology & Marketing

1. Receiving a handmade or personalized gift gives the recipient a sense of "vicarious pride," they share a sense of accomplishment with the gift maker1. Celebrating holiday traditions reinforces bonds with family, friends and community on a regular basis1. DIY, upcycling, and creative reuse are sustainable, and often more economical solutions to buying exclusively new or single use holiday and celebration decor
2. Making or personalizing a gift offers a meaningful creative outlet of self expression to the giver2. Sharing holiday traditions with others from different cultures creates opportunities to start conversations, share new experiences, and create memories2. Holiday decoration allows for community connection and personal expression and curation
3. Handmade and personalized gifts are often kept much longer than other gifts, making them a more sustainable alternative to other gifts3. Hosting or attending holiday celebrations is a tangible expression of optimistic, forward-looking thinking3. Holiday decoration is an important demonstration of personal taste and community optimism

PRIMARY COLLECTION

SPIRIT OF
GIVING

OVERVIEW

A truly thoughtful, intentional gift lets the recipient know they are valued, appreciated, and seen. For the giver, giving can forge bonds, express gratefulness, and be a conduit for creativity and personal expression. Through handmade, personalized, family, community gifting, and well-chosen ready-to-go gifting, givers and recipients can discover shared values, interests, hobbies, and learn a little bit more about what makes the other so unique.

CONSUMER

Virtually every consumer has gifting needs during the holidays. Explorers, Creators, and Artists will be first to try handmade gift ideas. Curators will enjoy perfecting personalized gifts. Variety Seekers will enjoy easy to complete craft and baking kits, and will be first in the impulse line.

OPPORTUNITY

Christmas is the perfect time for experienced crafters to express their talents, and aspiring crafters to try their hand at gift making. Personalized gifting needs provide a reason to invest in craft technology. Family gifting needs provide an opportunity for multiple craft kits and large crafting supply purchases, while community gifting is the perfect opportunity for themed gift baskets and repeat item purchases.

BOUGH
& BERRY

## OVERVIEW

Flickering candles and frosted windowpanes. Aromatic evergreens punctuated by bright red berries. Ring in the holidays with crisp red and white striping and classic holiday motifs, for a snowy winter season steeped in nostalgia, tradition, and warmth.

CONSUMER

All consumers will resonate with the traditional sensibility of Bough & Berry. Creators will delight in sharing their favorite holiday traditions with children and family. Curators will expertly arrange classic tablescapes and decor items in fresh new ways.

OPPORTUNITY

Lovers of tradition who still want a sense of newness during the holiday will find this updated traditional appeal is just what they need. Family and kids crafts provide a particular opportunity for Creators looking to build memories through shared holiday crafting and activities.

Summary : This figure presents two examples of holiday-themed typography styles, illustrating trends in hand-lettered script design: multi-colored, highly-decorated hand lettering and irregular hand-lettered scripts.

illustration:
# Typography Styles :
  • The heading "TYPOGRAPHY" introduces the subject.
  • Two styles are listed: 
    1. Multi-colored, Highly-decorated Hand Lettering
    2. Irregular Hand Lettered Scripts

## Example 1: Multi-colored, Highly-decorated Hand Lettering :
  • Phrase: "Merry & Bright"
  • Lettering is hand-drawn with playful, swirling lines.
  • Each letter is a different color (pink, red, green, yellow, blue).
  • Decorative elements include stars and sparkles around the text.
  • Ampersand (“&”) is large and ornate, with flourishes.

## Example 2: Irregular Hand Lettered Scripts :
  • Phrase: "OH WHAT FUN" repeated multiple times.
  • Letters are bold, blocky, and unevenly sized, giving an irregular, hand-crafted look.
  • Colors used: muted red, green, orange, and yellow.
  • Some letters are replaced with small Christmas tree icons.

GLOWING  
TRADITIONS

## OVERVIEW

Glowing candles. Gathering loved ones. Laughter and gifts shared over eight cozy nights. Glinting metallics, embroidered linens, and elegant table scapes come together in a joyful celebration of cherished traditions and newly made memories.

CONSUMER

Creators are specialists in preserving traditions while keeping loved ones entertained and engaged. Young explorers will take the opportunity to learn family traditions and update them with their own unique perspectives. Curators will refine carefully collected holiday decor with new handmade and finished additions.

OPPORTUNITY

Bakeware and food crafts are central to Hanukkah traditions. Easy wrap and packaging solutions for eight nights of gifts help customers streamline holiday celebrations. Personalized and handmade menorahs and candle sets allow celebrants to add a personal touch to their traditions.

Summary : This figure presents a color palette divided into "Core" and "Accent" groups, each with five color swatches labeled by their Pantone Matching System (PMS) codes.

color palette figure:
# Core Colors :
  • Five horizontal swatches, each labeled with PMS code.
  • PMS 9285: very light, off-white/cream.
  • PMS 9523: pale, cool light blue-green.
  • PMS 651: muted, medium light blue.
  • PMS 7694: deep, dark blue.
  • PMS 4278: medium gray.

# Accent Colors :
  • Five horizontal swatches, each labeled with PMS code.
  • PMS 124: bright yellow-gold.
  • PMS 2404: muted, light green.
  • PMS 7545: dark, muted blue-gray.
  • PMS 871 METALLIC: metallic gold.
  • PMS 8001 METALLIC: metallic silver-gray.

# Layout :
  • Two rows: "Core" on top, "Accent" below.

Summary : This figure presents a color palette system for a design or branding guide, showing full-spectrum color options categorized into core, accent, and metallics, each with their Pantone Matching System (PMS) codes and visual swatches.

color palette:
# Color System Overview :
  • The palette is described as "Full-spectrum color refracting of mirror-ball finishes."
  • Colors are grouped into three categories: Core, Accent, and Metallics.

# Core Colors :
  • PMS 2395: bright magenta
  • PMS 927: medium pink
  • PMS 9284: pale pink
  • PMS 3242: light teal
  • PMS 4159: deep blue

# Accent Colors :
  • PMS 177: light red
  • PMS 2010: bright orange
  • PMS 129: yellow
  • PMS 6169: green
  • PMS 270: lavender

# Metallics :
  • PMS 8001 METALLIC: light silver/grey metallic
  • PMS 871 METALLIC: gold metallic
  • PMS 876 METALLIC: bronze metallic

# Design Encodings :
  • Each color is displayed as a horizontal swatch with its PMS code labeled inside or below the swatch.
  • The palette is organized in three horizontal rows, one for each category.
  • Metallics are visually differentiated by a metallic sheen effect in their swatches.

# Analysis :
  • The palette covers a wide range of hues, from warm (magenta, orange, yellow) to cool (teal, blue, lavender, green), and includes metallic finishes for added versatility.
  • The core colors are mostly bright and pastel, while accent colors provide additional vibrancy and contrast.
  • The inclusion of metallics suggests an emphasis on finishes that reflect or refract light, aligning with the "mirror-ball" theme.

WRAP UP

# GIFTING, UNWRAPPED

THE THOUGHT DOES COUNT
KEY TAKEAWAYS

01  
CREATE  
Handmade and personalized gifts are seen as more thoughtful and valuable than other gifts, both to the gifter and to the recipient.

ACTION PLAN: Promote Michaels as the one-stop shop for DIY and personalized gifting. Create a maker wishlist registry so non-experts can easily shop for the experts in a more personal way than a gift card. Assort themed collections for Christmas Eve boxes, kindness jars, and customized gift baskets and group gifts.

02  
CELEBRATE  
Holiday gifting is a genuine expression of appreciation and care from the giver to the recipient, and can form and enrich social bonds.

ACTION PLAN: Position crafting as a gift of shared experiences. Assort entry level to expert level craft kits. Provide group and family crafting inspiration along with itemized shopping lists and/or one click “add all to cart” for group crafting supply lists.

03  
DECORATE  
For aspiring and entry level creative customers who want to make a handmade gift, but aren’t sure where to start, handmade decor items are a great place to start.

ACTION PLAN: Incorporate handmade holiday decor inspiration, kits, and supplies into holiday gifting promotions. Assort items based on the recipient (teacher, grandparent etc.) and by the maker’s skill level.
CONFIDENTIAL & PROPRIETARY INFORMATION. PLEASE DO NOT COPY.
WRAP UP

# PUT A BOW ON IT

CELEBRATING THE YEAR PAST,
LOOKING FORWARD TO THE YEAR AHEAD
KEY TAKEAWAYS

01
CREATE
For experienced crafters, the holidays are the perfect reason to initiate a new project. For aspiring crafters and artists, the New Year is the perfect time to learn a new craft or start a new creative practice.

ACTION PLAN: Promote the holidays as a time for expert artists and crafters to stock up on creative supplies. Take advantage of the holiday season as an entryway for aspiring creative consumers to take up a crafting habit that can continue into the New Year.

02
CELEBRATE
Holiday parties happen everywhere, from workplaces and schoolrooms to first apartments and family homes.

ACTION PLAN: Be the go-to supplier for on-trend finished and DIY party goods, for holiday parties of any size and personal style. Offer distinct holiday trend stories, with plenty of mix and match pieces for perfect party personalization.

03
DECORATE
Most people who celebrate the holidays will also decorate their homes.

ACTION PLAN: Make holiday decorating inspiring and easy with shoppable “rooms” at key locations where shoppers can purchase finished decor bundles such as tabletop themed party solutions for eight, complete Christmas tree decor sets, or all-in-one mantel decorating solutions.
